p: Hespiridin is a flavonoid with very limited knowledge of antiviral activities. A water-soluble derivative of hesperidin, glucosyl hesperidin has been reported to have in vitro inhibitory activities against human and avian influenza A viruses ( Saha et al., 2009). Our present data demonstrated the novel anti-HBV potential of hesperidin. In molecular docking, hesperidin formed bonds with Glu39, Ser40, Ser85, Ser117 and His156 where the hesperidin-Pol complex had a free energy of −9.3 kcal/mol.
